definition: wind direction/the way the wind is blowing/fig. trends (esp. unpredictable ones)/how things are developing/course of events
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...

sentences.english: The wind shifted from east to north.
You who travel with the wind, what weathervane shall direct your course?
sentences.chinese: 你是隨風旅行的人，什麼風向將會指引你該走了路呢？

sentences.english: How did this weather vane of the US economy become a car crash of a corporation?
sentences.chinese: 這個美國經濟的風向標是怎麼成爲一個公司的災難？

sentences.english: This would be a protective wind that would blow most of the radiation out to sea.
sentences.chinese: 這種風向可能將大多數核輻射吹向大海。

sentences.english: No sooner did it release its trial balloon on the Luxury Tax, than it met with a public backlash.
sentences.chinese: 課徵奢侈稅才放出風向球，就因民意反彈而收手等等。

sentences.english: The wind chopped back to the south.
Move over Lady Gaga. There are some new blue-haired songstresses taking over this Halloween.
sentences.chinese: 藍頭髮的女歌手們正取代她成爲這個萬聖節的風向標。

sentences.english: Wind speed and wind direction are important meteorological factors in ocean dynamic environment monitoring.
sentences.chinese: 海面風速風向是海洋動力環境監測的重要氣象要素。

sentences.english: Since the wind has changed, we brought the sails over.
sentences.chinese: 既然風向變了，我們扯帆轉向。

sentences.english: The wind veered (round to the) north.
In winter the weathervane often freezes up.
sentences.chinese: 氣象風向標在冬季經常僵立不動。

sentences.english: Rotating The landing of the first commonly after north south.
sentences.chinese: 其登陸時的風向一般先北後南。

sentences.english: To face the career life is the vane of humanities education.
sentences.chinese: 面向職業生活是高職院校人文教育的風向標。

sentences.english: The prevailing wind directions to be used in all locations are northwest and southeast.
sentences.chinese: 將用於所有位置的主要風向爲東北風和東南風。

sentences.english: B sudden shift in the wind warned of the coming storm.
sentences.chinese: 風向的俄然改變預示暴風雨到臨。

sentences.english: As the Greek ships gathered at the port of Aulis, no favouring wind blew up.
sentences.chinese: 當希臘艦隊停駐在奧利斯海港時，風向一直不順。

definition: now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
character acquired through long habit/habits and properties
conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
the two poles/the north and south poles/both ends of sth/electric or magnetic poles
to wait and see/to watch from the sidelines/to look around/to survey
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
